result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael J Werth was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.

Defendant shall attend the Victim/Offender Impact Panel. 
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Good Time granted. 
Defendant may serve in any county that can coordinate the arrangements. 
Huber/Work release privileges granted, and can be used to allow defendant to get his occupational license at DMV and to make his application at Probation & Parole office.

Operate vehicles only equipped with an ignition interlock device. 
1/2 Price IID granted.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Half-Price Ignition Interlock Device 
C: Defendant

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Werth
Current: 748 S Main St, Seymour, WI 54165 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2016)
Prior: 709 S Pearl St, New London, WI 54961

Defendant Michael J Werth in court with attorney Troy Louis Nielsen. 
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Guilty plea entered on Count 1. 
Plea accepted after rights explained and defendant is found guilty of Count 1. 
Count 2 is dismissed and read in. 
Count 3 is dismissed. 
Recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay fine and costs of $2494.50 
- pay supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV 
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his system 
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood 
- attend a victim/offender impact panel 
- operate vehicles only equipped with an ignition interlock device 
- 60 days jail, 2 days credit, Good Time granted, effective forthwith (report immediately) 
- defendant may serve jail time in any county that can coordinate the arrangements 
- Huber/Work release privileges granted, and can be used to allow defendant to get his occupational license at DMV and to make his application at Probation & Parole office 
Outside the conditions of probation, the following is ordered: 
- Ignition Interlock Device for a period of 1 year 
- 1/2 Price IID granted 
- Drivers license revocation for a period of 3 years, effective forthwith, with credit granted 
- AODA assessment and driver safety plan compliance 
Appeal rights explained.

copy sent to WCSO & Jail SGT

Defendant must continue to abstain from alcohol consumption.
